definitions: A legal concept that a participant accepts inherent risks of an activity.

A legal doctrine reducing responsibility when the injured party knowingly engages in risky activity.
An acknowledgement that some injuries may occur even with proper supervision and care.
A concept distinguishing inherent risks from risks created by negligence.

Failure to meet the standard of care owed to an individual.
A violation of the legal duty to act with reasonable care.
When a professional does not do what a reasonably competent professional would do.
Not providing appropriate supervision, instruction, or safe conditions when required.
A key element of negligence: duty existed, but was not fulfilled.
An omission or action that falls below accepted professional practice.
